" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001853": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001853", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Alcée Arobin! What on earth is his picture doing here?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001854": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001854", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001855": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001855", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I tried to make a sketch of his head one day,” answered Edna, “and he thought the photograph might help me. It was at the other house. I thought it had been left there. I must have packed it up with my drawing materials.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001856": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001856", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001857": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001857", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I should think you would give it back to him if you have finished with it.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001858": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001858", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001859": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001859", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Oh! I have a great many such photographs. I never think of returning them. They don’t amount to anything.” Robert kept on looking at the picture.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001860": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001860", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001861": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001861", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“It seems to me—do you think his head worth drawing? Is he a friend of Mr. Pontellier’s? You never said you knew him.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001862": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001862", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001863": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001863", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“He isn’t a friend of Mr. Pontellier’s; he’s a friend of mine. I always knew him—that is, it is only of late that I know him pretty well. But I’d rather talk about you, and know what you have been seeing and doing and feeling out there in Mexico.” Robert threw aside the picture.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001864": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001864", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001865": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001865", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I’ve been seeing the waves and the white beach of Grand Isle; the quiet, grassy street of the Chênière; the old fort at Grande Terre. I’ve been working like a machine, and feeling like a lost soul. There was nothing interesting.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001866": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001866", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001867": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001867", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She leaned her head upon her hand to shade her eyes from the light.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001868": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001868", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001869": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001869", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“And what have you been seeing and doing and feeling all these days?” he asked.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001870": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001870", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001871": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001871", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I’ve been seeing the waves and the white beach of Grand Isle; the quiet, grassy street of the Chênière Caminada; the old sunny fort at Grande Terre. I’ve been working with a little more comprehension than a machine, and still feeling like a lost soul. There was nothing interesting.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001872": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001872", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001873": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001873", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Mrs. Pontellier, you are cruel,” he said, with feeling, closing his eyes and resting his head back in his chair. They remained in silence till old Celestine announced dinner.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001874": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001874", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001875": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001875", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

XXXIV

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001876": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001876", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001877": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001877", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

The dining-room was very small. Edna’s round mahogany would have almost filled it. As it was there was but a step or two from the little table to the kitchen, to the mantel, the small buffet, and the side door that opened out on the narrow brick-paved yard.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001878": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001878", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001879": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001879", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

A certain degree of ceremony settled upon them with the announcement of dinner. There was no return to personalities. Robert related incidents of his sojourn in Mexico, and Edna talked of events likely to interest him, which had occurred during his absence. The dinner was of ordinary quality, except for the few delicacies which she had sent out to purchase. Old Celestine, with a bandana tignon twisted about her head, hobbled in and out, taking a personal interest in everything; and she lingered occasionally to talk patois with Robert, whom she had known as a boy.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001880": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001880", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001881": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001881", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

He went out to a neighboring cigar stand to purchase cigarette papers, and when he came back he found that Celestine had served the black coffee in the parlor.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001882": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001882", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001883": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001883", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Perhaps I shouldn’t have come back,” he said. “When you are tired of me, tell me to go.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001884": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001884", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001885": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001885", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“You never tire me. You must have forgotten the hours and hours at Grand Isle in which we grew accustomed to each other and used to being together.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001886": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001886", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001887": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001887", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I have forgotten nothing at Grand Isle,” he said, not looking at her, but rolling a cigarette. His tobacco pouch, which he laid upon the table, was a fantastic embroidered silk affair, evidently the handiwork of a woman.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001888": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001888", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001889": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001889", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“You used to carry your tobacco in a rubber pouch,” said Edna, picking up the pouch and examining the needlework.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001890": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001890", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001891": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001891", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Yes; it was lost.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001892": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001892", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001893": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001893", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Where did you buy this one? In Mexico?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001894": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001894", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001895": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001895", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“It was given to me by a Vera Cruz girl; they are very generous,” he replied, striking a match and lighting his cigarette.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001896": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001896", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001897": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001897", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“They are very handsome, I suppose, those Mexican women; very picturesque, with their black eyes and their lace scarfs.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001898": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001898", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001899": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001899", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Some are; others are hideous, just as you find women everywhere.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001900": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001900", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001901": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001901", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“What was she like—the one who gave you the pouch? You must have known her very well.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001902": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001902", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001903": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001903", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“She was very ordinary. She wasn’t of the slightest importance. I knew her well enough.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001904": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001904", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001905": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001905", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Did you visit at her house? Was it interesting? I should like to know and hear about the people you met, and the impressions they made on you.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001906": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001906", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001907": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001907", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“There are some people who leave impressions not so lasting as the imprint of an oar upon the water.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001908": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001908", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001909": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001909", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Was she such a one?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001910": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001910", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001911": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001911", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“It would be ungenerous for me to admit that she was of that order and kind.” He thrust the pouch back in his pocket, as if to put away the subject with the trifle which had brought it up.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001912": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001912", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001913": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001913", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Arobin dropped in with a message from Mrs. Merriman, to say that the card party was postponed on account of the illness of one of her children.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001914": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001914", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001915": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001915", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“How do you do, Arobin?” said Robert, rising from the obscurity.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001916": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001916", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001917": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001917", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Oh! Lebrun. To be sure! I heard yesterday you were back. How did they treat you down in Mexique?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001918": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001918", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001919": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001919", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Fairly well.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001920": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001920", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001921": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001921", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“But not well enough to keep you there. Stunning girls, though, in Mexico. I thought I should never get away from Vera Cruz when I was down there a couple of years ago.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001922": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001922", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001923": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001923", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Did they embroider slippers and tobacco pouches and hat-bands and things for you?” asked Edna.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001924": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001924", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001925": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001925", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Oh! my! no! I didn’t get so deep in their regard. I fear they made more impression on me than I made on them.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001926": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001926", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001927": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001927", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“You were less fortunate than Robert, then.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001928": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001928", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001929": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001929", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I am always less fortunate than Robert. Has he been imparting tender confidences?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001930": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001930", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001931": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001931", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I’ve been imposing myself long enough,” said Robert, rising, and shaking hands with Edna. “Please convey my regards to Mr. Pontellier when you write.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001932": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001932", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001933": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001933", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

He shook hands with Arobin and went away.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001934": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001934", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001935": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001935", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Fine fellow, that Lebrun,” said Arobin when Robert had gone. “I never heard you speak of him.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001936": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001936", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001937": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001937", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I knew him last summer at Grand Isle,” she replied. “Here is that photograph of yours. Don’t you want it?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001938": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001938", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001939": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001939", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“What do I want with it? Throw it away.” She threw it back on the table.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001940": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001940", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001941": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001941", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I’m not going to Mrs. Merriman’s,” she said. “If you see her, tell her so. But perhaps I had better write. I think I shall write now, and say that I am sorry her child is sick, and tell her not to count on me.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001942": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001942", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001943": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001943", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“It would be a good scheme,” acquiesced Arobin. “I don’t blame you; stupid lot!”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001944": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001944", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001945": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001945", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna opened the blotter, and having procured paper and pen, began to write the note. Arobin lit a cigar and read the evening paper, which he had in his pocket.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001946": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001946", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001947": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001947", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“What is the date?” she asked. He told her.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001948": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001948", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001949": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001949", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Will you mail this for me when you go out?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001950": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001950", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001951": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001951", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Certainly.” He read to her little bits out of the newspaper, while she straightened things on the table.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001952": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001952", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001953": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001953", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“What do you want to do?” he asked, throwing aside the paper. “Do you want to go out for a walk or a drive or anything? It would be a fine night to drive.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001954": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001954", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001955": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001955", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“No; I don’t want to do anything but just be quiet. You go away and amuse yourself. Don’t stay.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001956": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001956", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001957": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001957", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I’ll go away if I must; but I shan’t amuse myself. You know that I only live when I am near you.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001958": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001958", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001959": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001959", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

He stood up to bid her good night.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001960": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001960", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001961": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001961", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Is that one of the things you always say to women?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001962": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001962", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001963": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001963", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I have said it before, but I don’t think I ever came so near meaning it,” he answered with a smile. There were no warm lights in her eyes; only a dreamy, absent look.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001964": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001964", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001965": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001965", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Good night. I adore you. Sleep well,” he said, and he kissed her hand and went away.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001966": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001966", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001967": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001967", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She stayed alone in a kind of reverie—a sort of stupor. Step by step she lived over every instant of the time she had been with Robert after he had entered Mademoiselle Reisz’s door. She recalled his words, his looks. How few and meager they had been for her hungry heart! A vision—a transcendently seductive vision of a Mexican girl arose before her. She writhed with a jealous pang. She wondered when he would come back. He had not said he would come back. She had been with him, had heard his voice and touched his hand. But some way he had seemed nearer to her off there in Mexico.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001968": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001968", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001969": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001969", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

XXXV

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001970": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001970", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001971": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001971", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

The morning was full of sunlight and hope. Edna could see before her no denial—only the promise of excessive joy. She lay in bed awake, with bright eyes full of speculation. “He loves you, poor fool.” If she could but get that conviction firmly fixed in her mind, what mattered about the rest? She felt she had been childish and unwise the night before in giving herself over to despondency. She recapitulated the motives which no doubt explained Robert’s reserve. They were not insurmountable; they would not hold if he really loved her; they could not hold against her own passion, which he must come to realize in time. She pictured him going to his business that morning. She even saw how he was dressed; how he walked down one street, and turned the corner of another; saw him bending over his desk, talking to people who entered the office, going to his lunch, and perhaps watching for her on the street. He would come to her in the afternoon or evening, sit and roll his cigarette, talk a little, and go away as he had done the night before. But how delicious it would be to have him there with her! She would have no regrets, nor seek to penetrate his reserve if he still chose to wear it.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001972": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001972", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001973": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001973", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna ate her breakfast only half dressed. The maid brought her a delicious printed scrawl from Raoul, expressing his love, asking her to send him some bonbons, and telling her they had found that morning ten tiny white pigs all lying in a row beside Lidie’s big white pig.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001974": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001974", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001975": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001975", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

A letter also came from her husband, saying he hoped to be back early in March, and then they would get ready for that journey abroad which he had promised her so long, which he felt now fully able to afford; he felt able to travel as people should, without any thought of small economies—thanks to his recent speculations in Wall Street.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001976": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001976", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001977": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001977", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Much to her surprise she received a note from Arobin, written at midnight from the club. It was to say good morning to her, to hope she had slept well, to assure her of his devotion, which he trusted she in some faintest manner returned.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001978": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001978", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001979": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001979", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

All these letters were pleasing to her. She answered the children in a cheerful frame of mind, promising them bonbons, and congratulating them upon their happy find of the little pigs.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001980": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001980", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001981": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001981", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She answered her husband with friendly evasiveness,—not with any fixed design to mislead him, only because all sense of reality had gone out of her life; she had abandoned herself to Fate, and awaited the consequences with indifference.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001982": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001982", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001983": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001983", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

To Arobin’s note she made no reply. She put it under Celestine’s stove-lid.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001984": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001984", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001985": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001985", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna worked several hours with much spirit. She saw no one but a picture dealer, who asked her if it were true that she was going abroad to study in Paris.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001986": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001986", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001987": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001987", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She said possibly she might, and he negotiated with her for some Parisian studies to reach him in time for the holiday trade in December.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001988": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001988", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001989": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001989", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Robert did not come that day. She was keenly disappointed. He did not come the following day, nor the next. Each morning she awoke with hope, and each night she was a prey to despondency. She was tempted to seek him out. But far from yielding to the impulse, she avoided any occasion which might throw her in his way. She did not go to Mademoiselle Reisz’s nor pass by Madame Lebrun’s, as she might have done if he had still been in Mexico.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001990": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001990", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001991": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001991", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

When Arobin, one night, urged her to drive with him, she went—out to the lake, on the Shell Road. His horses were full of mettle, and even a little unmanageable. She liked the rapid gait at which they spun along, and the quick, sharp sound of the horses’ hoofs on the hard road. They did not stop anywhere to eat or to drink. Arobin was not needlessly imprudent. But they ate and they drank when they regained Edna’s little dining-room—which was comparatively early in the evening.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001992": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001992", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001993": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001993", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

It was late when he left her. It was getting to be more than a passing whim with Arobin to see her and be with her. He had detected the latent sensuality, which unfolded under his delicate sense of her nature’s requirements like a torpid, torrid, sensitive blossom.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001994": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001994", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001995": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001995", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

There was no despondency when she fell asleep that night; nor was there hope when she awoke in the morning.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001996": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001996", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001997": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001997", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

XXXVI

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001998": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001998", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001999": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000001999", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

There was a garden out in the suburbs; a small, leafy corner, with a few green tables under the orange trees. An old cat slept all day on the stone step in the sun, and an old mulatresse slept her idle hours away in her chair at the open window, till some one happened to knock on one of the green tables. She had milk and cream cheese to sell, and bread and butter. There was no one who could make such excellent coffee or fry a chicken so golden brown as she.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002000": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002000", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002001": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002001", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

The place was too modest to attract the attention of people of fashion, and so quiet as to have escaped the notice of those in search of pleasure and dissipation. Edna had discovered it accidentally one day when the high-board gate stood ajar. She caught sight of a little green table, blotched with the checkered sunlight that filtered through the quivering leaves overhead. Within she had found the slumbering mulatresse, the drowsy cat, and a glass of milk which reminded her of the milk she had tasted in Iberville.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002002": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002002", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002003": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002003", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She often stopped there during her perambulations; sometimes taking a book with her, and sitting an hour or two under the trees when she found the place deserted. Once or twice she took a quiet dinner there alone, having instructed Celestine beforehand to prepare no dinner at home. It was the last place in the city where she would have expected to meet any one she knew.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002004": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002004", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002005": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002005", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Still she was not astonished when, as she was partaking of a modest dinner late in the afternoon, looking into an open book, stroking the cat, which had made friends with her—she was not greatly astonished to see Robert come in at the tall garden gate.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002006": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002006", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002007": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002007", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I am destined to see you only by accident,” she said, shoving the cat off the chair beside her. He was surprised, ill at ease, almost embarrassed at meeting her thus so unexpectedly.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002008": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002008", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002009": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002009", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Do you come here often?” he asked.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002010": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002010", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002011": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002011", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I almost live here,” she said.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002012": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002012", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002013": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002013", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I used to drop in very often for a cup of Catiche’s good coffee. This is the first time since I came back.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002014": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002014", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002015": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002015", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“She’ll bring you a plate, and you will share my dinner. There’s always enough for two—even three.” Edna had intended to be indifferent and as reserved as he when she met him; she had reached the determination by a laborious train of reasoning, incident to one of her despondent moods. But her resolve melted when she saw him before designing Providence had led him into her path.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002016": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002016", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002017": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002017", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Why have you kept away from me, Robert?” she asked, closing the book that lay open upon the table.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002018": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002018", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002019": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002019", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Why are you so personal, Mrs. Pontellier? Why do you force me to idiotic subterfuges?” he exclaimed with sudden warmth. “I suppose there’s no use telling you I’ve been very busy, or that I’ve been sick, or that I’ve been to see you and not found you at home. Please let me off with any one of these excuses.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002020": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002020", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002021": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002021", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“You are the embodiment of selfishness,” she said. “You save yourself something—I don’t know what—but there is some selfish motive, and in sparing yourself you never consider for a moment what I think, or how I feel your neglect and indifference. I suppose this is what you would call unwomanly; but I have got into a habit of expressing myself. It doesn’t matter to me, and you may think me unwomanly if you like.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002022": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002022", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002023": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002023", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“No; I only think you cruel, as I said the other day. Maybe not intentionally cruel; but you seem to be forcing me into disclosures which can result in nothing; as if you would have me bare a wound for the pleasure of looking at it, without the intention or power of healing it.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002024": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002024", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002025": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002025", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I’m spoiling your dinner, Robert; never mind what I say. You haven’t eaten a morsel.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002026": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002026", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002027": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002027", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I only came in for a cup of coffee.” His sensitive face was all disfigured with excitement.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002028": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002028", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002029": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002029", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Isn’t this a delightful place?” she remarked. “I am so glad it has never actually been discovered. It is so quiet, so sweet, here. Do you notice there is scarcely a sound to be heard? It’s so out of the way; and a good walk from the car. However, I don’t mind walking. I always feel so sorry for women who don’t like to walk; they miss so much—so many rare little glimpses of life; and we women learn so little of life on the whole.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002030": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002030", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002031": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002031", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Catiche’s coffee is always hot. I don’t know how she manages it, here in the open air. Celestine’s coffee gets cold bringing it from the kitchen to the dining-room. Three lumps! How can you drink it so sweet? Take some of the cress with your chop; it’s so biting and crisp. Then there’s the advantage of being able to smoke with your coffee out here. Now, in the city—aren’t you going to smoke?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002032": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002032", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002033": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002033", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“After a while,” he said, laying a cigar on the table.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002034": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002034", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002035": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002035", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Who gave it to you?” she laughed.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002036": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002036", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002037": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002037", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I bought it. I suppose I’m getting reckless; I bought a whole box.” She was determined not to be personal again and make him uncomfortable.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002038": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002038", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002039": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002039", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

The cat made friends with him, and climbed into his lap when he smoked his cigar. He stroked her silky fur, and talked a little about her. He looked at Edna’s book, which he had read; and he told her the end, to save her the trouble of wading through it, he said.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002040": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002040", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002041": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002041", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Again he accompanied her back to her home; and it was after dusk when they reached the little “pigeon-house.” She did not ask him to remain, which he was grateful for, as it permitted him to stay without the discomfort of blundering through an excuse which he had no intention of considering. He helped her to light the lamp; then she went into her room to take off her hat and to bathe her face and hands.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002042": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002042", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002043": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002043", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

When she came back Robert was not examining the pictures and magazines as before; he sat off in the shadow, leaning his head back on the chair as if in a reverie. Edna lingered a moment beside the table, arranging the books there. Then she went across the room to where he sat. She bent over the arm of his chair and called his name.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002044": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002044", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002045": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002045", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Robert,” she said, “are you asleep?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002046": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002046", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002047": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002047", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“No,” he answered, looking up at her.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002048": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002048", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002049": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002049", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She leaned over and kissed him—a soft, cool, delicate kiss, whose voluptuous sting penetrated his whole being—then she moved away from him. He followed, and took her in his arms, just holding her close to him. She put her hand up to his face and pressed his cheek against her own. The action was full of love and tenderness. He sought her lips again. Then he drew her down upon the sofa beside him and held her hand in both of his.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002050": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002050", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002051": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002051", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Now you know,” he said, “now you know what I have been fighting against since last summer at Grand Isle; what drove me away and drove me back again.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002052": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002052", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002053": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002053", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Why have you been fighting against it?” she asked. Her face glowed with soft lights.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002054": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002054", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002055": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002055", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Why? Because you were not free; you were Léonce Pontellier’s wife. I couldn’t help loving you if you were ten times his wife; but so long as I went away from you and kept away I could help telling you so.” She put her free hand up to his shoulder, and then against his cheek, rubbing it softly. He kissed her again. His face was warm and flushed.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002056": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002056", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002057": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002057", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“There in Mexico I was thinking of you all the time, and longing for you.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002058": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002058", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002059": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002059", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“But not writing to me,” she interrupted.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002060": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002060", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002061": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002061", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Something put into my head that you cared for me; and I lost my senses. I forgot everything but a wild dream of your some way becoming my wife.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002062": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002062", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002063": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002063", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Your wife!”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002064": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002064", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002065": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002065", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Religion, loyalty, everything would give way if only you cared.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002066": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002066", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002067": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002067", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Then you must have forgotten that I was Léonce Pontellier’s wife.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002068": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002068", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002069": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002069", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Oh! I was demented, dreaming of wild, impossible things, recalling men who had set their wives free, we have heard of such things.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002070": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002070", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002071": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002071", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Yes, we have heard of such things.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002072": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002072", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002073": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002073", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I came back full of vague, mad intentions. And when I got here—”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002074": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002074", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002075": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002075", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“When you got here you never came near me!” She was still caressing his cheek.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002076": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002076", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002077": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002077", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I realized what a cur I was to dream of such a thing, even if you had been willing.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002078": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002078", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002079": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002079", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She took his face between her hands and looked into it as if she would never withdraw her eyes more. She kissed him on the forehead, the eyes, the cheeks, and the lips.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002080": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002080", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002081": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002081", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“You have been a very, very foolish boy, wasting your time dreaming of impossible things when you speak of Mr. Pontellier setting me free! I am no longer one of Mr. Pontellier’s possessions to dispose of or not. I give myself where I choose. If he were to say, ‘Here, Robert, take her and be happy; she is yours,’ I should laugh at you both.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002082": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002082", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002083": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002083", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

His face grew a little white. “What do you mean?” he asked.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002084": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002084", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002085": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002085", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

There was a knock at the door. Old Celestine came in to say that Madame Ratignolle’s servant had come around the back way with a message that Madame had been taken sick and begged Mrs. Pontellier to go to her immediately.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002086": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002086", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002087": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002087", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Yes, yes,” said Edna, rising; “I promised. Tell her yes—to wait for me. I’ll go back with her.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002088": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002088", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002089": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002089", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Let me walk over with you,” offered Robert.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002090": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002090", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002091": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002091", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“No,” she said; “I will go with the servant.” She went into her room to put on her hat, and when she came in again she sat once more upon the sofa beside him. He had not stirred. She put her arms about his neck.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002092": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002092", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002093": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002093", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Good-by, my sweet Robert. Tell me good-by.” He kissed her with a degree of passion which had not before entered into his caress, and strained her to him.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002094": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002094", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002095": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002095", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I love you,” she whispered, “only you; no one but you. It was you who awoke me last summer out of a life-long, stupid dream. Oh! you have made me so unhappy with your indifference. Oh! I have suffered, suffered! Now you are here we shall love each other, my Robert. We shall be everything to each other. Nothing else in the world is of any consequence. I must go to my friend; but you will wait for me? No matter how late; you will wait for me, Robert?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002096": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002096", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002097": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002097", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Don’t go; don’t go! Oh! Edna, stay with me,” he pleaded. “Why should you go? Stay with me, stay with me.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002098": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002098", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002099": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002099", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“I shall come back as soon as I can; I shall find you here.” She buried her face in his neck, and said good-by again. Her seductive voice, together with his great love for her, had enthralled his senses, had deprived him of every impulse but the longing to hold her and keep her.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002100": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002100", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002101": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002101", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

XXXVII

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002102": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002102", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002103": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002103", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna looked in at the drug store. Monsieur Ratignolle was putting up a mixture himself, very carefully, dropping a red liquid into a tiny glass. He was grateful to Edna for having come; her presence would be a comfort to his wife. Madame Ratignolle’s sister, who had always been with her at such trying times, had not been able to come up from the plantation, and Adèle had been inconsolable until Mrs. Pontellier so kindly promised to come to her. The nurse had been with them at night for the past week, as she lived a great distance away. And Dr. Mandelet had been coming and going all the afternoon. They were then looking for him any moment.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002104": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002104", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002105": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002105", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna hastened upstairs by a private stairway that led from the rear of the store to the apartments above. The children were all sleeping in a back room. Madame Ratignolle was in the salon, whither she had strayed in her suffering impatience. She sat on the sofa, clad in an ample white peignoir, holding a handkerchief tight in her hand with a nervous clutch. Her face was drawn and pinched, her sweet blue eyes haggard and unnatural. All her beautiful hair had been drawn back and plaited. It lay in a long braid on the sofa pillow, coiled like a golden serpent. The nurse, a comfortable looking Griffe woman in white apron and cap, was urging her to return to her bedroom.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002106": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002106", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002107": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002107", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“There is no use, there is no use,” she said at once to Edna. “We must get rid of Mandelet; he is getting too old and careless. He said he would be here at half-past seven; now it must be eight. See what time it is, Joséphine.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002108": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002108", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002109": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002109", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

The woman was possessed of a cheerful nature, and refused to take any situation too seriously, especially a situation with which she was so familiar. She urged Madame to have courage and patience. But Madame only set her teeth hard into her under lip, and Edna saw the sweat gather in beads on her white forehead. After a moment or two she uttered a profound sigh and wiped her face with the handkerchief rolled in a ball. She appeared exhausted. The nurse gave her a fresh handkerchief, sprinkled with cologne water.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002110": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002110", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002111": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002111", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“This is too much!” she cried. “Mandelet ought to be killed! Where is Alphonse? Is it possible I am to be abandoned like this—neglected by every one?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002112": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002112", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002113": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002113", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Neglected, indeed!” exclaimed the nurse. Wasn’t she there? And here was Mrs. Pontellier leaving, no doubt, a pleasant evening at home to devote to her? And wasn’t Monsieur Ratignolle coming that very instant through the hall? And Joséphine was quite sure she had heard Doctor Mandelet’s coupé. Yes, there it was, down at the door.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002114": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002114", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002115": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002115", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Adèle consented to go back to her room. She sat on the edge of a little low couch next to her bed.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002116": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002116", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002117": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002117", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Doctor Mandelet paid no attention to Madame Ratignolle’s upbraidings. He was accustomed to them at such times, and was too well convinced of her loyalty to doubt it.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002118": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002118", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002119": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002119", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

He was glad to see Edna, and wanted her to go with him into the salon and entertain him. But Madame Ratignolle would not consent that Edna should leave her for an instant. Between agonizing moments, she chatted a little, and said it took her mind off her sufferings.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002120": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002120", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002121": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002121", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna began to feel uneasy. She was seized with a vague dread. Her own like experiences seemed far away, unreal, and only half remembered. She recalled faintly an ecstasy of pain, the heavy odor of chloroform, a stupor which had deadened sensation, and an awakening to find a little new life to which she had given being, added to the great unnumbered multitude of souls that come and go.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002122": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002122", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002123": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002123", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She began to wish she had not come; her presence was not necessary. She might have invented a pretext for staying away; she might even invent a pretext now for going. But Edna did not go. With an inward agony, with a flaming, outspoken revolt against the ways of Nature, she witnessed the scene of torture.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002124": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002124", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002125": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002125", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

She was still stunned and speechless with emotion when later she leaned over her friend to kiss her and softly say good-by. Adèle, pressing her cheek, whispered in an exhausted voice: “Think of the children, Edna. Oh think of the children! Remember them!”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002126": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002126", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002127": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002127", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002128": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002128", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

XXXVIII

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002129": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002129", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002130": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002130", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Edna still felt dazed when she got outside in the open air. The Doctor’s coupé had returned for him and stood before the porte cochère. She did not wish to enter the coupé, and told Doctor Mandelet she would walk; she was not afraid, and would go alone. He directed his carriage to meet him at Mrs. Pontellier’s, and he started to walk home with her.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002131": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002131", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002132": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002132", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

Up—away up, over the narrow street between the tall houses, the stars were blazing. The air was mild and caressing, but cool with the breath of spring and the night. They walked slowly, the Doctor with a heavy, measured tread and his hands behind him; Edna, in an absent-minded way, as she had walked one night at Grand Isle, as if her thoughts had gone ahead of her and she was striving to overtake them.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002133": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002133", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002134": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002134", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“You shouldn’t have been there, Mrs. Pontellier,” he said. “That was no place for you. Adèle is full of whims at such times. There were a dozen women she might have had with her, unimpressionable women. I felt that it was cruel, cruel. You shouldn’t have gone.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002135": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002135", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002136": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002136", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Oh, well!” she answered, indifferently. “I don’t know that it matters after all. One has to think of the children some time or other; the sooner the better.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002137": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002137", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002138": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002138", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“When is Léonce coming back?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002139": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002139", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002140": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002140", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Quite soon. Some time in March.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002141": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002141", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002142": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002142", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“And you are going abroad?”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002143": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002143", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002144": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002144", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Perhaps—no, I am not going. I’m not going to be forced into doing things. I don’t want to go abroad. I want to be let alone. Nobody has any right—except children, perhaps—and even then, it seems to me—or it did seem—” She felt that her speech was voicing the incoherency of her thoughts, and stopped abruptly.

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002145": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002145", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002146": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002146", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“The trouble is,” sighed the Doctor, grasping her meaning intuitively, “that youth is given up to illusions. It seems to be a provision of Nature; a decoy to secure mothers for the race. And Nature takes no account of moral consequences, of arbitrary conditions which we create, and which we feel obliged to maintain at any cost.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002147": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002147", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002148": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002148", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“Yes,” she said. “The years that are gone seem like dreams—if one might go on sleeping and dreaming—but to wake up and find—oh! well! perhaps it is better to wake up after all, even to suffer, rather than to remain a dupe to illusions all one’s life.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002149": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002149", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002150": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002150", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "

“It seems to me, my dear child,” said the Doctor at parting, holding her hand, “you seem to me to be in trouble. I am not going to ask for your confidence. I will only say that if ever you feel moved to give it to me, perhaps I might help you. I know I would understand. And I tell you there are not many who would—not many, my dear.”

" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002151": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002151", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
" }, "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002152": { "role": "text", "title": "$:/plugins/twpub/3ae35ef49641be75/text/000002152", "type": "text/vnd.twpub", "text": "
